title: Pistachio
content:
PISTACHIO

The "pistachios" mentioned in Genesis 43:11 are probably pistachio nuts from the pistachio tree (Pistacia vera), which is closely related to the terebinth. The pistachio tree grows to a height of 3 to 9.1 meters (10 to 30 feet) with a spreading top. This tree can be found growing wild in many rocky areas of Lebanon and Israel and the surrounding areas. The pistachio nut has a light-colored shell, and the kernel inside has a sweet, delicate flavor that people enjoy wherever the tree grows.

See Food and Food Preparation, Terebinth.
